intro: Trachydium dichotomum, commonly known as the forked liverwort, is a small, non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its leafy, thalloid structure that often branches into two parts, giving it the common name. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually arranged in a rosette pattern and are covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. Trachydium dichotomum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
